data.chText: 凝视；注视；盯着
data.enText: to look steadily at sb/sth for a long time, either because you are very interested or surprised, or because you are thinking of sth else

data.chText: 她惊异地注视着他。
data.enText: She gazed at him in amazement.

data.chText: 他一连几个小时坐在那里茫然地看着前面。
data.enText: He sat for hours just gazing into space .

data.chText: 凝视；注视
data.enText: a long steady look at sb/sth

data.chText: 他与她凝视的目光相遇。
data.enText: He met her gaze (= looked at her while she looked at him) .

data.chText: 她目光低垂，不再凝视。
data.enText: She dropped her gaze (= stopped looking) .

data.text: look ♦ glance ♦ gaze ♦ stare ♦ glimpse ♦ glare

data.chText: 以上各词均表示看的动作。
data.enText: These are all words for an act of looking, when you turn your eyes in a particular direction.

data.chText: 指看、瞧：
data.enText: an act of looking at sb/sth

data.chText: 来，看一看这个。
data.enText: Here, have a look at this.

data.chText: 指匆匆一看、一瞥、扫视：
她偷偷看了看表。
data.enText: She stole a glance at her watch.

data.chText: 指凝视、注视：
data.enText: a long steady look at sb/sth

data.chText: 她在他凝视的目光下感到很尴尬。
data.enText: She felt embarrassed under his steady gaze.

data.chText: 尤指不友善或吃惊的盯、凝视、注视：
data.enText: a long look at sb/sth, especially in a way that is unfriendly or that shows surprise

data.chText: 她面无表情地盯着那官员，耸了耸肩。
data.enText: She gave the officer a blank stare and shrugged her shoulders.

data.chText: 指一瞥、一看：
data.enText: a look at sb/sth for a very short time, when you do not see the person or thing completely

data.chText: 他在人群里一眼瞥见了她。
data.enText: He caught a glimpse of her in the crowd.

data.chText: 指长久的怒视、瞪眼：
data.enText: a long angry look at sb/sth

data.chText: 她敌意地瞪着向她提问的人。
data.enText: She fixed her questioner with a hostile glare.

data.chText: 以上各词均含盯着看、凝视、注视之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to look at sb/sth for a long time.

data.chText: 尤指吃惊、害怕或深思地盯着看、凝视、注视：
data.enText: to look at sb/sth for a long time, especially with surprise or fear, or because you are thinking

data.chText: 我尖叫一声，众人都盯着我看。
尤指吃惊、爱恋或深思地凝视、注视、盯着：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to look steadily at sb/sth for a long time, especially with surprise or love, or because you are thinking

data.chText: 我们都惊异地注视着马可。
data.enText: We all gazed at Marco in amazement.

data.chText: 尤指看不清楚时仔细看、端详
data.enText: to look closely or carefully at sth, especially when you cannot see it clearly

data.chText: 指怒目而视：
data.enText: to look angrily at sb/sth for a long time

data.chText: 我看了她一眼，她便冷冷地回瞪着我。
data.enText: I looked at her and she glared stonily back.

ex.enText: She sat gazing out the window.

ex.chText: 我告诉她这消息时，她以怀疑的目光注视着我。
ex.enText: She gazed at me in disbelief when I told her the news.

synonyms.bx: 常指长时间无意识地或因好奇、惊讶等而盯着看。

ex.chText: 她的表演使我们惊讶得瞠目结舌。
ex.enText: We gaped in amazement at her performance.

ex.chText: 人们呆呆地看着那个叫姚明的高个子篮球队员。
ex.enText: People were gaping at the tall basketball player, Yao Ming.

synonyms.bx: 指因惊讶或震惊而张着嘴、瞪大眼睛呆看。

ex.chText: 这一对冤家怒目而视，准备打斗。
ex.enText: The rivals are glaring at each other, ready to fight.

ex.chText: 尽管母亲制止了两个女儿打架，她们依然怒视对方。
ex.enText: Although the mother stopped her daughters fighting, they still glared at each other.

synonyms.bx: 指长时间用愤怒的目光凝视着某人或某物。

ex.enText: It is rude to stare at other people.
He was staring out at the sea.

synonyms.bx: 指因生气、惊讶、思考等而瞪大眼睛长时间地注视某人或某物。

example: he fixed his paternal gaze on me
The students stared at the teacher with amazement

value.def: If you gaze at someone or something, you look steadily at them for a long time, for example because you find them attractive or interesting, or because you are thinking about something else.

example.ex: She stood gazing at herself in the mirror...
example.tran: 她站在那儿，凝视着镜中的自己。

example.ex: Sitting in his wicker chair, he gazed reflectively at the fire...
example.tran: 他坐在藤椅上，若有所思地凝视着炉火。

example.ex: The girls stood still, gazing around the building, trying to picture life there fifty years before.
example.tran: 女孩子们静静地站着，仔细打量这幢建筑，尽力想象50年前这里的生活情景。

value.def: You can talk about someone's gaze as a way of describing how they are looking at something, especially when they are looking steadily at it.

example.ex: The Monsignor turned his gaze from the flames to meet the Colonel's...
example.tran: 这位大人凝视的目光离开火苗，与上校的目光相遇。

example.ex: She felt increasingly uncomfortable under the woman's  steady gaze...
example.tran: 那个女人一直盯着她看，让她觉得愈发不自在了。

example.ex: The interior was shielded from the curious gaze of passersby.
example.tran: 屋子内部被挡住了，以防路人好奇地张望。

value.def: If someone or something is in the public gaze, they are receiving a lot of attention from the general public.

example.ex: You won't find a couple more in the public gaze than Michael and Lizzie.
example.tran: 没有比迈克尔和莉齐更受人瞩目的夫妇了。

value.boxu_tran: 动词gaze和stare都可以用来表示长时间地注视某物。gaze at常指因所见之物精彩或壮观而盯着看，例如：A fresh-faced little girl gazes in wonder at the bright fairground lights(一位脸蛋红扑扑的小女孩惊奇地盯着游乐场里那些明亮的彩灯）。stare at常指因某物怪异或令人震惊而瞪着眼睛看：Various families came out and stared at us（家家户户的人都出来盯着我们看）。
value.boxu_usage: The verbs gaze and stare are both used to talk about looking at something for a long time. If you gaze at something, it is often because you think it is marvellous or impressive. A fresh-faced little girl gazes in wonder at the bright fairground lights. If you stare at something or someone, it is often because you think they are strange or shocking. Various families came out and stared at us.
